intro: Mariscus micranthes, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mariscus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to tolerate salt spray and well-drained conditions. Mariscus micranthes is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and blooms.
